title: How can renewable energy help the people under the poverty line to generate income? What are the challenges and opportunities? - Quora

response.answer_text: Renewable energy is already helping people in many poor countries to become educated and to generate income through small businesses. A small solar PV module with small battery is quite cheap nowadays. Unlike kerosene lighting, solar provides bright light for studying, shops and simple tourist accommodation, without pollution. For peasant farmers with middle incomes upwards, solar runs irrigation pumps. In parts of India and Bangladesh, biogas from cow manure provides fuel for cooking with much less pollution than burning cow dung, leaves and twigs. However, it can only be used by rural people who have access to manure from a sufficient number of cows. In some rich countries, low-income people who are home-owners can purchase or lease rooftop solar PV with no up-front cost, paying it off, for example, on the local government rates. In some places, low-income people who rent their homes can obtain a share in a solar garden, receiving the benefits of cheaper, cleaner electricity. Solar gardens, with land (or rooftops) provided by local governments and businesses, are growing in numbers.
